text: Puppis is a constellation that can be seen in the southern sky. It is one of the 88 modern constellations recognized by the International Astronomical Union. ==Notable features== Argo Navis was sub-divided in 1752 by the French astronomer Nicolas Louis de Lacaille, forming Puppis. ==References== ==Other websites== * The Deep Photographic Guide to the Constellations: Puppis * Star Tales â€“ Puppis * Puppis Constellation at Constellation Guide Category:Constellations
title: Puppis
